application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA
description:
Our PeopleDev team works hard to ensure every Googler has access to the resources they need to become their best personal and professional selves. We leverage tools, technology, and innovative formats to scale learning and support Googlers at all stages of their careers — from Noogler Orientation, to manager training, to leadership development, and more. We have four key beliefs about learning — that it is personal, social, a process, and happens in real life — and we infuse these beliefs throughout the wide array of learning and development opportunities at Google. As a PeopleDev team member, you'll always be thinking about new ways to help others grow, and you share a passion for empowering Googlers to unlock their full potential.

All Googlers deserve a great manager. As a Manager for People Development Programs, you’ll lead a small team of talented program managers who deliver onboarding programs at key points in a manager’s career - from becoming a manager for the first time, to managing other managers. Your work will impact thousands of managers and the Googlers reporting to them each year. You will improve manager capability at the enterprise level by ensuring each program achieves its learning objectives, while driving operational efficiency across a portfolio of scaled programs (i.e., New Manager Flagship, Noogler Manager Conference, Managing at Scale).

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of work experience, including 5 years in a related field (e.g., Learning and Development, Talent Management, Leadership Development, Operational Management, HR).
  • 5 years of experience in people management.
  • Experience designing scaled onboarding plans for new hires, new managers, and new leaders.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree or PhD in a relevant field (e.g., Organizational Development, Psychology, Change Management, etc.).
  • Experience designing and implementing leadership programs to employees at all levels.
  • Experience collaborating across multiple stakeholders groups to deliver solutions.
  • Excellent analytical and project management skills.
responsibilities:
• Lead and coach a dynamic team of Program Managers. Be an great people manager, attending to morale, engagement, and career development needs, and work with Learning Programs leads to ensure professional development of program managers over time.
  • Design, deliver, and lead manager development initiatives for managers at critical transition points in their careers (e.g., becoming a new manager, managing other managers).
  • Partner with teams across People Development and People Operations (POps) partners/consultants to ensure offerings are aligned with business needs.
  • Support measurement strategy to ensure data-based approach to evaluating and improving offerings.
  • Partner with People Development peers and others to ensure initiatives are aligned to complementary work for leaders.
title: Manager, People Development Programs
